Description: Set the name of the server as it appears publicly
DefaultValue: AMP Powered ARK: Survival Evolved Server

Description: Sets the player welcome message (MOTD)
DefaultValue: Welcome to ARK! Hosted by AMP by CubeCoders

Description: Sets the duration of the welcome message
Sets the map for the server. If Custom is selected, Custom Map Name must also be set
Sets a custom map for the server. The custom map files must be included in the ShooterGame/Content/Mods directory. Automanaged Mods can be used for this purpose

If set, enables automatic mod download and updating (on server start). Mods listed under Load Mods will be managed accordingly. Otherwise the mods must be specified in Game.ini under the heading [ModInstaller] and with one mod per line in the format: ModIDS=<value>
Comma-separated list of mod IDs for mods to load on the server. The mod files must be included in the ShooterGame/Content/Mods directory
Sets the server's active event, if any. Some events may only work partially or not at all
List of Steam64 IDs for whitelisted server admins. [Find Steam64 IDs](https://steamidfinder.com/). These admins do not need to use the server admin password
Sets the password for players to join the server
If set, only players with Steam64 IDs listed on the Player Whitelist can join the server
List of Steam64 IDs for whitelisted players. [Find Steam64 IDs](https://steamidfinder.com/)
Sets the password for non-admin spectators on the server
Sets the maximum number of players allowed on the server
Sets the binding of the server. Default is blank. Change to internal interface IP if required
If set, BattlEye will be enabled on the server
If set, enables crossplay between Epic Game Store players and Steam players. Do not enable Epic Only at the same time
If set, only Epic Game Store players will be able to connect to the server. Do not enable Crossplay at the same time
Sets the public IP for Epic Game Store players to connect to. If not set, and MultiHome IP Binding is specified but is not a public IP, then Epic Game Store players will not be able to connect
If set, enables Vivox on Steam only servers (Vivox is the default for Epic Game Store enabled servers)
If set, disables Valve Anti-Cheat (VAC). Only works on Windows
Uses the global banlist of ARK to disallow access to players who have been identified as cheaters
If set, all admin commands used will be logged to in-game chat
If set, PvP servers generate a timestamped kill and winners log in the Saved directory, listing Steam ID, Steam name, character name, etc
If set, characters that have not moved or interacted within the Kick Idle Players Period will be kicked from the server
Sets the time period after which characters that have not moved or interacted will be kicked (if Kick Idle Players is enabled)
Sets the interval for automatic saves. 0 = constant saving, 9000000 = effectively disabled
Set the language of the server
Sets custom [command line flags](https://ark.fandom.com/wiki/Server_configuration#Command_line_arguments) for the server (those that start with a - (dash). Include the dash and separate with a space

Sets custom [command line options](https://ark.fandom.com/wiki/Server_configuration#Command_line_arguments) for the server (those that start with a ? (question mark). Include the question mark but do not separate with a space
If set, PvE will be enabled, and PvP disabled
If set, third person view is enabled
If set, allows building in caves when PvE mode is enabled
If set, players will always be notified if someone joins the server
If set, players will always be notified if someone leaves the server
If set, flying dinosaurs will be permitted to pick up other dinosaurs and players when mounted by a player in PvE mode
If set, the gradual (7 days) decay of player structures will be disabled in PvE mode
If set, voice chat will be enabled globally
If set, wild dinosaurs will not be spawned in the server. For an existing server, existing dinosaurs need to be wiped with the admin command "destroywilddinos"
If set, creatures in inactive zones will not hibernate, at the cost of performance and memory usage
If set, all wild creatures that are not currently being tamed will be destroyed on server start
If set, flyer dinosaurs will be allowed into caves
If set, non-meat fish loot when using the fishing rod will be disabled
Only players near each other can see their chat messages.

DisplayName: Resource No Replenish Radius to Players
Description: Defines the distance where there are no resources respawning when being close to a player.

DisplayName: Resource No Replenish Radius to Players
Description: Defines the distance where there are no resources respawning when being close to a player.

DisplayName: Resource No Replenish Radius to Structures
Description: Defines the distance where there are no resources respawning when being close to Structures.
Shows Crosshair
Force Players No Hud
Enables hardcore mode (player characters revert to level 1 upon death)
Show each player their own precise position when they view their map
Allows or disallows usage of gamma on PVP servers.
Allows or disallows usage of gamma on PVE servers.
Specifies the difficulty level.

Sets the scaling factor for the server day/night cycle. The default value 1 sets the same speed as a singleplayer game, ie 1 minute real time = approx 28 minutes server time. A scale of 0.035 would set a day/night cycle of approx 24 hours real time
Sets the scaling factor for the length of each server day, relative to the length of each night. Lowering this value increases the day length
Sets the scaling factor for the length of each server night, relative to the length of each day. Lowering this value increases the night length
Sets the scaling factor for player characters' food consumption. Higher values increase food consumption (player characters get hungry faster)
Sets the scaling factor for player characters' water consumption. Higher values increase water consumption (player characters get thirsty faster)
Sets the scaling factor for player characters' health recovery. Higher values increase the recovery rate (player characters heal faster)
Sets the scaling factor for player characters' stamina consumption. Higher values increase stamina consumption (player characters get tired faster)
Sets the scaling factor for the damage players cause with their attacks. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values increase damage. Lower values decrease it

Sets the scaling factor for players' damage resistance when attacked. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values decrease resistance, increasing damage per attack. Lower values increase it, reducing damage per attack
Sets the scaling factor for dinosaurs' food consumption. Higher values increase food consumption (dinosaurs get hungry faster)
Sets the scaling factor for dinosaurs' health recovery. Higher values increase the recovery rate (dinosaurs heal faster)
Sets the scaling factor for dinosaurs' stamina consumption. Higher values increase stamina consumption (dinosaurs get tired faster)
Sets the scaling factor for the damage dinosaurs cause with their attacks. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values increase damage. Lower values decrease it

Sets the scaling factor for dinosaurs' damage resistance when attacked. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values decrease resistance, increasing damage per attack. Lower values increase it, reducing damage per attack
Sets the scaling factor for dinosaur spawns. Higher values increase the number of dinosaurs spawned throughout the server
Sets the scaling factor for the damage structures  (spiked walls) cause with their attacks. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values increase damage. Lower values decrease it

Sets the scaling factor for structures' damage resistance when attacked. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values decrease resistance, increasing damage per attack. Lower values increase it, reducing damage per attack
Sets the scaling factor for the damage tamed dinosaurs cause with their attacks. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values increase damage. Lower values decrease it

Sets the scaling factor for tamed dinosaurs' damage resistance when attacked. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values decrease resistance, increasing damage per attack. Lower values increase it, reducing damage per attack

Sets the scaling factor for yields from all harvesting activities (chopping down trees, picking berries, carving carcasses, mining rocks, etc). Higher values increase the amount harvested with each strike

Sets the scaling factor for the "health" of harvestable items (trees, rocks, carcasses, etc). Higher values increase the number of strikes they can withstand before being destroyed, increasing harvest yields
Sets the scaling factor for the resource node respawn rate (trees, rocks, bushes, etc). Lower values cause nodes to respawn more frequently
Sets the scaling factor for dinosaur taming speed. Higher values make taming faster

Sets the scaling factor for experience (XP) received by players, tribes and dinosaurs for various actions. The default value 1 provides the same experience as a singleplayer game. Higher values increase XP amounts awarded, lower values decrease it
If set, auto destruction of old structures will be enabled. The destruction timer can be adjusted with Automatic Structure Destruction Multiplier
Specifies the scaling factor for the decay rate of player structures in PvE mode.
Specifies the time required for player structures to decay in PvE mode.
If enabled, activates structure decay on PVP servers
Deactivates the unclaiming functions for dinosaurs on PVE servers
Multiplier value for the unclaiming speed of dinosaurs
Sets the maximum amount of tamed dinosaurs on the server. This is a global cap

DisplayName: Max Number of Players In a Tribe(SOTF)
Description: SOTF setting: Defines the maximum player limit per tribe

DisplayName: Min Num Of Tribes to Start Battle(SOTF)
Description: SOTF setting: Defines how many tribes must have been created before the countdown for game start begins

DisplayName: Time To Collapse Ring Of Death(SOTF)
Description: SOTF setting: Defines the time period for the force field to collapse
SOTF setting: Defines the length of the countdown before match begins
SOTF setting: Defines the time before sudden death starts
Defines the multiplicator for structures on saddle plattforms (Caution - High values may lead to LAG)
Defines the cooldown time when a previously damaged structure can be repaired again. (0 allows the structure to be always repaired)
Server Option to allow Locking All Item Containers
Server Option to allow Auto-Destroying Structures after no near tribe player time has passed (defined as a multiplier of the Allow Claim period)
Defines the maximum number of structures on top of the saddle platform
Wild dinos or dinos without a rider can take damage from defense structures like spikewalls if this setting is activated
Determines if turrets are allowed on moving platforms or not. On will prevent it. Off will allow it
Defines the time period of being offline so that a player will be really considered as being offline.
Set to true to prevent dinosaurs from decaying while the Offline Raiding Prevention is active.
Deactivates (no) the bonus stats for a dino if you raise the baby by yourself

DisplayName: Block building in Rich Resource Areas
Description: Prevents the building of structures on places which are rich of resources
Shows dealt damages in a RPG style
If active, it will destroy the pipes automatically after two real-time days, if unconnected to any non-pipe (directly or indirectly) and no allied player is nearby.
New value for the maximum allowed structures on the server.
Number of seconds cooldown between allowed Dino re-uploads (defaults to 0, set to 43200 on Official Servers which is 12 hours).

DisplayName: PvE Allow Structures At Supply Drops
Description: Set to true to allow building near supply drop points in PvE mode..
Quantity of dinos that a tribe is allowed to have (Default on official PVE servers is 500).
Option to auto-destroy claimable decayed dinos on load, rather than have them remain around as claimable. Official PvE servers now have this enabled.

Server custom HarvestAmountMultiplier now works as it used to, to bias towards yielding rarer items. This is more costly for server performance, so if you want a more optimized server with high HarvestAmountMultiplier (but less rare items).

DisplayName: Allow crate spawns on top of structures
Description: Servers can now allow from-the-air Supply Crates to appear on top of Structures, rather than being prevented by Structures. Enabled on Official Servers.
Flyer (except Quetzal and Wyvern can't fly with C4 attached to it. Set this parameter to true to let them still fly.
Use this to enable the offline raiding prevention option.
Set to true if flyers should recover stamina when player is standing on instead riding.
Set to true to allow to attach more than one C4 per dino.
Use this to set how swim speed is multiplied by level spent in oxygen.
Prevent-Friendly-Fire (among tribesmates/tribesdinos/tribesstructures) option for PvE server.
If true, disables fog.
If true, supply drops are in random locations. NOTE: This setting is known to cause artifacts becoming inaccesable on [Ragnarok] if active.

DisplayName: Cross ARK Allow Foreign Dino Downloads
Description: if set to true, you will be able to tribute download non-native creatures on the Aberration map

DisplayName: Personal Tamed Dinos Saddle Structure Cost
Description: determines the amount of dinoslots a platform saddle will use towards the tribe dino limit.
If set, allows for structures to clip into the terrain
If set, prevents friendly fire among tribesmates, tribesdinosaurs and tribesstructures on PvP servers
If set, prevents friendly fire among tribesmates, tribesdinosaurs and tribesstructures on PvE servers

Sets the path to a shared cluster directory for a server cluster. The cluster directory must be accessible to all cluster servers. If the server is in Docker, the directory must be mounted in the container
Sets the cluster ID for a server cluster. The cluster ID must be the same on all servers in the cluster
If set, prevents uploads from and downloads to servers that are not part of the cluster
If set, prevents the download of characters from a cluster to the server
If set, prevents the download of survivors from a cluster to the server
If set, prevents the download of items from a cluster to the server
If set, prevents the download of tamed dinosaurs from a cluster to the server
If set, prevents the upload of survivors from the server to a cluster
If set, prevents the upload of items from the server to a cluster
If set, prevents the upload of tamed dinosaurs from the server to a cluster
